New Records: This is India's highest T20I score in Sri Lanka.
74 runs is the highest powerplay score for India against Sri Lanka in T20Is.
Key Match Events: India scored 213/7 runs in 20 overs, thanks to Suryakumar Yadav's half century (58 off 26 balls), Yashasvi Jaiswal's 40 off 21 balls, Rishabh Pant's 49 off 33 balls, and Shubman Gill's 34 off 16 deliveries.
Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka scored 79 off 48 balls and Kusal Mendis scored 45 off 27 balls.
Riyan Parag picked three wickets for India, while Arshdeep Singh and Axar Patel took two wickets each.
India won the match by 43 runs, taking a 1-0 lead in the three-T20 match series.
Pre-Game Insights: New India T20 captain Suryakumar Yadav will take charge of the 3 match T20 series against Sri Lanka starting today at Pallekele International Cricket Stadium.
Surya has big shoes to fill in leading the world champions and taking over the charge of team after the retirement of skipper Rohit Sharma.
Coach Gautam Gambhir will also be keenly looking forward to starting on a positive note with a dominating effort against a full-strength Sri Lankan side.
Focus will also be on Shubman Gill who has now been elevated to the post of vice-captain after an impressive outing as a skipper in the recently concluded Zimbabwe series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pallekele International Cricket Stadium offers a balanced batting track, offering equal opportunities for bowlers and batters. The monsoon season will make the dew factor significant.
The average first-innings score at this venue is 171. The highest successful chase is 196.
Thunderstorms have lashed Kandy, where the match will take place. It won’t settle down before 3 PM and will again be active around 5 PM. The match is scheduled to start at 7 PM.
As per AccuWeather, the chances of rain during the match are as low as 10%. The temperature will be in mid-20s. The humidity will be 80-90% during the play.
